comments.author: tbsaunde+mozbugs@tbsaunde.org
comments.creator: tbsaunde+mozbugs@tbsaunde.org
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110222 Firefox/4.0b12pre
Build Identifier: 

spun off from bug 634218 comment 18

we have to states for accessible objects sensitive and enabled which we currently treat as the same.  ATk considers these states to be distinct, describing enabled as reflecting something in the application and sensitive as can react to user input. I don't believe IA2 / msaa defines these states.  We should either get rid of the dupplicate state, or use them differently.

Reproducible: Always
